title: In the movie 'Inside Out', which character attempts to block the expression of particular feelings? How do they do so? Do you find yourself blocking feelings consistently? - Quora

response.answer_text: Joy was blocking all of the other emotions because she is personifying Riley’s optimism blocking her complicated emotions. She is a young girl and therefore unable to deal with complex feelings. She hides her sorrow because she is afraid that is not the appropriate behavior at the time. Eventually, she does allow her other emotions to take control and they learn to balance themselves as they control Riley through the movie. Sometimes, we just try to bottle up emotions because we are not ready to deal with certain feelings. It happens because we are human. However, it is always important to express our emotions healthily so we don’t snap and do something regretful.

It’s been so long since I have seen the movie, I don’t remember which character it was who tried to block the expression of feelings and emotions. I guess they do so by just stuffing it down inside. Which for real life humans is very unhealthy. I don’t hide, block, or suppress my emotions. I let myself feel what I feel and I let the emotions connected to whatever it is I feel express themselves.
